attributes.action: Funding home visits in times of crisis by trained mental health professionals
attributes.background: After a local woman tried to take her life, the community were left horrified in discovering proper professional help was not available to her, and she was left for hours before receiving the help she needed.
attributes.additional_details:
We are calling for more funding and correct training for these circumstances so that no one needing help in times of crisis are left without it. This woman was fortunate to have a strong community of neighbours who were able to help her.

It's easy to point the finger and say people in need should seek help, but what happens when the help just isn't there?

attributes.action: The United Kingdom should have its very own  Interstellar Space Force.
attributes.background: In order to maintain close ties with our greatest ally, the United States, I call upon the UK government to pledge to the nation that we will introduce a bill for the establishment of a new branch of the Armed Forces - our very own Space Force.
attributes.additional_details: We just need it.

attributes.action: Make "vlogging" whilst driving illegal
attributes.background: Many youtubers are creating vlog videos whilst driving where they are talking to and looking at their camera and therefore becoming distracted from the road and becoming dangers to themselves and other road users. This will be encouraging others, especially young inexperienced drivers to do the same
attributes.additional_details: Vlogging is a form of online video blog usually shared via YouTube in which an individual talks to a camera, adrressing the audience. 100s of vlogs and drive with me videos can be accessed at the click of button. Those featured in these vlogs are popular young adults acting as role models for young and vulnerable teenagers who won't always realise they can be putting their own and other lives at risk if they are inspired to copy the actions as the youtubers face no consequence for their actions

attributes.action: Require ride-sharing services to give drivers equity to operate in the UK
attributes.background: To get a license to operate in the UK, all "gig economy" types of companies such as Uber, Gett, Deliveroo, etc. would be required to designate a pool of equity (or cash from its sale) to its workers. This would be distributed on a negotiated per mile/hour basis + a 'time on network' + rating policy.
attributes.additional_details:
Protect Intelligent Systems Workers

Any worker who contributes to an intelligent network, AI or algorithm that will put their long-term work at risk should participate in the long-term equity success of that network or system because they are helping to build it.

The government should make this equity grant a requirement of entry into any city or town and should hold in escrow either equity, funds or both to protect the longterm future of these intelligent systems workers. 

www.found.ee/taxi

attributes.action: Make more council houses available for part rent, part buy
attributes.background: I'm a working dad of 2 children under 2 year old. Me and my partner can't afford to live together as I don't earn enough to support us and pay private rent. The Government should introduce a scheme to make more council homes available for families to part rent part buy to get on the property ladder.
attributes.additional_details: More and more families are struggling to live together with young children. My children are 14 month old and a 2 week old. Like a lot of families me and my partner can’t afford to live together as I work full time and she doesn't as she raises the children. The systems we have in this country don't help people who work. Help to buy is only good if you can afford to save but with young children and paying rent that's more than a mortgage, it's hard to save.

attributes.action: Provide a minimum of 100 litres of clean water per person daily, free of charge
attributes.background:
Water supply is fast becoming one of the most expensive utilities.
I believe every UK citizen should be entitled to a minimum amount, supplied free of charge by all regional water companies, enough to provide the basic human needs and maintain health and hygiene at a good standard.
attributes.additional_details:
Water is now an expensive commodity.
There is no option of choice of supplier in the water supply industry for private households.
Water is a life essential and any modern country should be required to provide a minimum amount free of charge to maintain health in the population.

attributes.action: Equal rights for boys up to their 18th birthday to receive the HPV vaccine.
attributes.background: Today 24/7/18, the government announced that boys aged 12-13 will receive the HPV vaccine from 2019. While this is great news,   I would like to petition the government to increase the age limit to the same that is offered to girls, up to their 18th birthday.
attributes.additional_details:
A jab that protects against a virus that causes cervical cancer will be given to boys aged 12 to 13 in England. 
The policy decision brings England into line with Scotland and Wales. 
HPV vaccine is already routinely offered to girls of the same age at secondary school and is free up until they turn 18.
Experts and campaigners have been calling for equal access to the jab, which can also guard against oral, throat and anal cancers.

attributes.action: Give cadet forces more funding + get all air cadets squadrons back in the sky.
attributes.background: Cadet funding is low, especially in areas such as the Thongsbridge detachment, as their cadet building is more of a mobile home than a building. Furthermore, more than half of the air cadet forces have had their volountier glider squadrons disbanded, meaning these air cadets can no longer fly planes
attributes.additional_details:
https://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/2016/03/19/air-cadet-cuts-will-see-more-than-half-of-squadrons-axed/ - air cadets grounded evidence

https://armycadets.com/about-us/acf-structure/the-acfa/about-acfa/acfa-funding/ - Cadets are currently charity funded

https://www.sea-cadets.org/how-were-funded - sea cadets are funded by the individual cadets and fundraising

More cadet funding will help improve the cadet forces, teaching young people great skills and getting more kids off the streets.

attributes.action: Increase government funding for assisted living facilities in care homes.
attributes.background: How much do you think care homes cost per week? You'd be surprised to find out the national average is £600, excluding nursing. This high price tag does not match the quality of the services provided. Help us to change this, as well as your possible future.
attributes.additional_details: We are Team Ward from Preston NCS - Wave 4. NCS, which stands for National Citizen Service, is a programme which encourages young people to engage in social action and make a difference in society. Recently, we visited a local care home. We were shocked at the visible lack of staff to help support the service users when we arrived. After this experience, we decided we were going to try and make a difference by starting this petition.

attributes.action: Stop Water companies from draining UK taxable profits by ‘Earnings Stripping’
attributes.background: Utilities companies’ taxable profits are being drained by large foreign-owned multinationals. The profits subsidise their global monopolization and enrich the 1% high wealth investors. Government’s tax revenue destined for health and welfare is being permanently lost.
attributes.additional_details:
Multinationals reduce their taxable profits by deducting interest payments on loans held by another subsidiary located in a low tax jurisdiction.
 
The Government should change tax regulation to prevent this and should: 
-disallow for tax purposes the company’s interest expense on non-infrastructure borrowings and cap annual deduction to 1% of turnover; 
-disallow all non-UK intragroup recharges from subsidiaries/related parties above 5% of turnover.

attributes.action: Lower the age of being able to change your name by deed poll to 13
attributes.background: A teenager should be able to change their name if they want to and not have to wait until they are 16.
attributes.additional_details:
I know a lot of teens that wanted to change their names before they hit 13 but they couldn't because they don't always have permission off both parents even if one parent has been absent for most of their lives or has caused destruction in their lives.
They should have the right to decide.

attributes.action: Change the policy on Bereavement Benefit.
attributes.background: I lost my husband some years ago, I have two children with my late husband who are both under the age of 16.  I was receiving bereavement benefit which went towards the support of my children, very much like child maintenance.  I then lost this benefit when I started a new relationship.
attributes.additional_details: This benefit would have been paid till the children were 18, however because I have tried to rebuild my life the benefit stops.  I now have to rely on my new partner to support my children.  My view is why are bereaved parents penalised for moving on in their life, yet had my husband not have died he would be paying me child maintenance roughly the same period of time.  It is not fair that any bereaved parent should be penalised.

attributes.action: Increase the maximum jail term for flying a drone over a UK airport to 10 years.
attributes.background:
The signatories to this petition want to see the maximum sentence for flying an unmanned drone over a UK airport increased from 5 to 10 years.

We also want clear direction given to the courts that severe sentences - close to or at the maximum - should be handed down for such reckless behaviour.
attributes.additional_details:
We have recently seen (December 2018) the scant disregard for the safety of aircraft, passengers and staff by those intentionally flying an unmanned drone over protected airspace at London Gatwick Airport.

Given the risk to human life from such reckless actions, and the significant cost and disruption, signatories to this period want to see the minimum sentence raised to ten years and used for mindless idiots endangering life.

attributes.action: Publish Northern Ireland (no border) planning papers in a no-deal Brexit
attributes.background: The government has published numerious technical notices for a no-deal Brexit outcome. Information provided covers a wide range of topics, from pet travel requirements to pharmaceuticals. Since EU can't stop the UK from a no-deal Brexit, what are the governments unilateral contingency plans for N.I.
attributes.additional_details: https://www.gov.uk/government/collections/how-to-prepare-if-the-uk-leaves-the-eu-with-no-deal#overview

attributes.action: Propose that the European Union be disband.
attributes.background: Greece is bankrupt, Italy is bankrupt, Spain, Cyprus and now France are all on the brink on bankruptcy. Why do people want us to remain when we are going lose all money within a couple of months.
attributes.additional_details:
http://blogs.lse.ac.uk/europpblog/2012/06/18/abandon-eu/ 
https://www.theguardian.com/commentisfree/2016/may/26/danger-brexit-break-up-eu-europe-russia 
https://www.debate.org/opinions/should-the-european-union-be-dissolved

attributes.action: Parliament to allow the electorate to have a yes or no referendum on referendums
attributes.background: We the public are being constantly told we must have another referendum for different issues. Do we as a country want to have them in our constitution, do we have a vote on the same issue every 2 or 5 years like some want on the EU issue.
attributes.additional_details:
Some requests for referendums on the petition website: 
Hold a referendum on the final Brexit deal 
Stop possible second referendum on E.U. membership 
Hold a referendum for the legalisation of cannabis 
In 2019 hold a referendum to reinstate capital punishment 
All UK citizens have the right to vote on referendums affecting the UK's future. 
Hold a referendum on Proportional Representation for parliamentary elections

attributes.action: Make it an offence to share film footage of assault with intent to humiliate.
attributes.background: Too many young people are sharing footage of fights and assaults with the intent to humiliate the innocent victims.
attributes.additional_details: I would like the UK government to make it illegal to share film footage on social media or via phone to phone where the intent is to humiliate the victim. An example being the young innocent girl who was seriously assaulted and then the footage was shared with the intent to cause her further distress.

attributes.action: Change the curriculum to provide greater mental health support in education.
attributes.background:
bangthedesk.com is campaigning to change the curriculum and reform the education system.

Suicide is the leading cause of death among young people in the UK; this peaks in exam season.

We can statistically prove the damaging affect of stress on young people, so why are we doing nothing to help?
attributes.additional_details:
Bang The Desk is petitioning the government to make the following changes to the UK school curriculum:

1. Remove formal testing for anyone under the age of 18.

2. Increase funding for the arts. 
​
3. Introduce an hour of wellbeing into the curriculum every day.

4. Start and end every school day with 10 minutes of mindfulness.

5. Greater mental health support across all educational institutions; mandatory counselling once a month for every student.
​
6. Better wages and support for teachers.

attributes.action: Hold a second referendum on our EU membership, but this time including the Euro
attributes.background: In the 2016 EU referendum, there were 2 choices: Leave or Remain. We had our say. But there is a third-way: let's call it Re-Join. No more opt-outs. No more pound, even. Proper EU membership, like Germany and France. Are we so sure we want to leave, versus just joining up properly like the rest?
attributes.additional_details: The past two years have seen plenty of surprises with respect to the EU, some unpleasant. But like the turkeys who don't vote for Christmas, nobody in Westminster is offering us the one EU choice that might actually be worth considering: full membership, including the Euro. It could be our country's best bet, though. No more pound, yes. But no need for one, if our banks are built not to need bailing out in the first place. As for jobs, let's just say the sucking sound would be in our direction.

attributes.action: Make MPs vote by secret ballot in Parliament
attributes.background: When we hold a General Election, a Local Election, a Referendum or when a union holds a strike ballot, voting is done by secret ballot, to remove intimidation. We should insist on nothing less for our MPs, to allow them to vote with their consciences and best judgement, and to prevent intimidation.
attributes.additional_details:
The Brexit debates in Parliament have shown, time and again, that party leaders can, and do, influence the way their MPs vote.
 
If all Parliamentary votes were by secret it would empower Parliament to actually be our Supreme lawmaking body, and prevent Governments from sidelining it

attributes.action: Remove free bus travel from under 16s
attributes.background: Child obesity is big concern in this day & age. By removing free travel, more children would walk to school instead of jumping on bus for just one or two stops!
attributes.additional_details: Removal of children's free travel will not only help obesity, but also cut congestion on buses, where people going to work & the elderly could get a seat

attributes.action: Create provision in law for Overtime Payments & max normal hours to be 40/week!
attributes.background: In current Law there is no provision for maximum working week i.e. what hours an employee must work on normal basis and there is no provision for overtime payments. Working over for free IS EXPLOITATION. and we, the working people who are your employers do deserve payment for worked hours!
attributes.additional_details:
Please set the following in the Employment Law: 
- max contractual normal working hours to be 40 hours per week 
 and anything above and over 40hours/week to be considered overtime 
- make an explicit provision in law that any overtime must be paid for 
 and minimum rates shall be: 
 - 1.33x or above for overtime worked on a normal working day 
 - 1.50x or above for overtime worked on Saturday 
 - 2.00x or above for overtime worked on Sunday or Public/Bank Holiday 
Working for Free is EXPLOITATION

attributes.action: Increase threshold for considering a petition for debate from 100,000 signatures
attributes.background: 100,000 signatures is not a true reflection of the population, and should not be debated in parliament. Present day we have 67 million people in the UK and so 1% of the population would be a more realistic figure. This then can be reviewed every 10 million the population increases.I

attributes.action: Abolish married couple's allowance and marriage allowance
attributes.background: This legislation is outdated and discriminatory. It discriminates against asexuals and aromatics. It is also sexist as for those on married couple's allowance (who married before December 2005), the break is based in the husband's income regardless of who actually earns the most.
attributes.additional_details: I believe this law to be in breach of the Equality Act 2010 as it discriminates on the basis of sexuality and (in the case of the married couple's allowance) gender. I believe this to be archaic and not at all fitting with the present times - married people are not any poorer than cohabiting or single people. So why should they be taxed less? Why do we still have a law that is based on the husband's income? It's 2018 isn't it?

attributes.action: Redirect UK's funds from backup power subsidies to invest in renewable energy.
attributes.background:
ECJ rules UK backup power subsidies are illegal.

These subsidies counterproductively give funds to fossil fuel generators.
attributes.additional_details:
https://www.jurist.org/news/2018/11/ecj-rules-uk-backup-power-subsidies-are-illegal/#

http://curia.europa.eu/juris/document/document.jsf?text=&docid=207792&pageIndex=0&doclang=en&mode=req&dir=&occ=first&part=1&cid=1430154

https://www.theguardian.com/environment/2018/nov/15/uk-backup-power-subsidies-illegal-european-court-capacity-market

https://uk.investing.com/news/commodities-news/uk-must-halt-backup-power-scheme-after-eu-court-ruling-1382121

https://www.theguardian.com/business/2017/jan/30/ban-coal-backup-power-subsidy-scheme-scottishpower

attributes.action: Make using someone else’s pictures on dating sites a criminal offence
attributes.background: Using someone else’s photos and private details on social media, dating sites and sex sites should be illegal. It causes distress to the person being impersonated, can be used in a malicious way like I have had done to myself.
attributes.additional_details:
I have had my photo uploaded, nick name only family members know me by, location and made up sexual interests added to sex dating sites claiming I’m unhappily married. By someone I know. 

At the moment there is no law against this but this needs to change as it causes so much hurt and embarrassment, and is a nasty form of bullying. 

People are also lured in by the photo and think they are talking to this person when they actually aren’t which again just causes hurt and embarrassment.

attributes.action: Ban Blockchain Mining in the UK
attributes.background: The mining of cryptocurrency such as bitcoin is responsible for the output of enormous amounts of carbon dioxide emissions, the effects of which could cause substantial damage to the environment and contribute to global warming, rising sea levels and more unpredictable extreme weather.
attributes.additional_details:
https://www.theguardian.com/technology/2018/jan/17/bitcoin-electricity-usage-huge-climate-cryptocurrency

https://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/2018/10/29/bitcoin-may-cause-catastrophic-climate-change-2033-study-warns/

attributes.action: Exempt Start-Up Businesses from the SME R&D Tax Credit Payment PAYE Restriction.
attributes.background: At a time when Britain looks to lead the world in technological innovation, for many start-up businesses, the SME R&D Tax Credit payment provides a vital source of cashflow.  Companies that are carrying out genuine R&D should not be penalised for being unable to afford to hire permanent staff.

attributes.action: Fund a campaign to promote the use of biodegradable hemp packaging
attributes.background: Plastic is fast becoming a problem that humans have caused. Damaging our oceans, infecting sea life and ourselves whilst polluting our planet on a worrying scale. We need to act fast and greatly reduce the amount of plastic being produced. We need to switch to a bio degradable alternative, hemp.
attributes.additional_details:
It is estimated that over 12 tonnes of plastic ends up in our oceans each year. 
The plastic is appearing all over the planet, from beaches here in the U.K. To uninhabited islands in the Pacific. Not only is it choking sealife but it has become part of the food chain eventually ending up on our plate. A biodegradable alternative like Hemp plastic would stop this poison destroying our oceans and our planet.

attributes.action: Ask the government to increase funding for osteoporosis
attributes.background:
The information that is out there is vague nothing definitive also testing not done until too late in most cases 
Like lots of diseases early diagnosis is the way forward

attributes.action: Ban all chewing gum except therapeutic, dental or nicotine chewing gum.
attributes.background: Chewing gum is pointless. Everywhere you look. There are small white blobs on the pavement - in schools, towns, in public transport, under tables and chairs and even in supermarkets making Britian's town's and cities a unsightly place to live.
attributes.additional_details:
The annual clean-up bill on the UK’s streets has been estimated at £150m. Some councils spend £200,000 a year cleaning up gum from pavements with high-powered hoses. Cash-strapped council's could use this money better elsewhere like Housing, transport, education, police funding AND THE NHS.
On average it costs £1.00 for an average pack of chewing gum, but it costs £1.50 to remove a single piece of dropped gum. This is a waste of tax payers money!
It also causes a nuisance in schools.

attributes.action: Make domestic abuse punishments more severe.
attributes.background: 1 in 5 children in the UK have witnessed domestic abuse, this can psychologically torment and haunt these young, innocent, minds. With more support from the government we could make the punishment more severe to make people thing twice before they partake in this disgusting crime.
attributes.additional_details:
Only 46% of domestic abuse crimes ended in arrests in 2007 which deters others from reporting the abuse.
70% of all domestic abuse stories are female.
On average an individual will have been abused 35 times before reporting.
Domestic abuse costs the public £23 billion each year.

attributes.action: To change the Gambling Act to protect minors from loot boxes in computer games.
attributes.background: Games companies are making poor quality games to maximize player spending. Players are gambling real world currency, by exchanging it for virtual currency to play built in slot machines. There are match making algorithms to match weaker players with better ones.
attributes.additional_details:
This will make the weaker player jealous, tempting them to gambling money on the loot boxes on the pay-to-win game. Gambling can be addictive, and children are more susceptible to being addicted. All the transactions and electronically automated, so children with no concept of money will keep opening loot boxes. It's a very scummy, shady tactic used by some games companies. And it's typically the case that the only thing you can buy in the game is solely the virtual currency for opening loot boxes in one game mode
 
Please sign

attributes.action: Make it compulsory for all adults working with children to be first aid trained.
attributes.background: Not all members of preschool/school staff are first aid trained only a select few. Trained adults can be absent from work or out on a course or a school trip and leave the school without a first aider. This is a particular issue at lunchtimes in school when the adult ratio to children is often low.
attributes.additional_details: Children can have many complex medical needs/ food allergies. As well as everyday trips and bumps in the playground. Unfortunately acciends have been reported in the news and a recent case of a boy choking at lunchtime. All staff should be trained to avoid being left without a first aider for our children when they need one. All adults working with children should know what to do.

attributes.action: Introduce free flu jabs for people using Lithium Carbonate for Bipolar disorder
attributes.background: Lithium Carbonate is considered to be the gold standard for controlling the symptoms of bipolar disorder, however, the symptoms of flu including diarrhoea, vomiting, dehydration and fever are exactly those which can cause Lithium toxicity which can quickly become fatal.
attributes.additional_details: By providing flu vaccinations, the government will be taking a pre-emptive step, reducing the risk of lithium toxicity while, at the same time, reducing the number of hospital beds taken up and allowing treatment of flu victims who require it.

attributes.action: Let people 17 and over get tattoos with parental consent
attributes.background: This petition is to let people get tattoos at the age of 17 with parental consent. Some people get tattoos when drunk. This would not be the case if it was made so that 17 year olds needed parental consent. They wouldn't be drunk with their parents so I think it would be perfectly reasonable.

attributes.action: Safeguard School Milk Funding Post-Brexit
attributes.background: With funding for the EU School Milk Scheme under consideration, and the Nursery Milk Scheme being consulted on, millions of children may be at risk of missing out on milk that generations before them received. We're calling on the Government to commit to funding a replacement scheme post-Brexit

attributes.action: Fund a National Holodomor Memorial
attributes.background: The Holodomor was a famine that occurred in the years 1932-33 in what is now Ukraine. It is recognised as genocide or as a criminal act of the Stalinist Regime by 22 countries. While the undersigned support the government's decision not to join these countries, we believe it deserves recognition.
attributes.additional_details: The government has chosen (quite rightly) to construct a memorial to the Holocaust. We believe that the Holodomor was horrific enough to merit this same recognition. A memorial to those who died in the Holodomor (some 7.5 million people, according to some estimates) would serve as a message that the UK truly rejects this kind of evil in whatever form it takes, whether blatant or less conspicuous and whether from the left or the right of the political spectrum.

attributes.action: Make schools provide 20 mins planned exercise each day to tackle rising obesity.
attributes.background:
Planned exercise should be fun, incorporating lifestyle / healthy eating guidance:
- Prevention is better than cure / better than keep bemoaning pressure on NHS etc
- Learning at school should be about whole person and their future life chances, not just the constraints of the curriculum
attributes.additional_details:
This should be in ALL schools. In primary schools the data from the National Child Measurement Programme could be used to measure progress.
Educational attainment would be expected to increase as a result.

Some factors:
- Screen time: video games, mobiles etc
- Taxi of Mum/Dad
- Over-protective parents limiting kids' freedom to roam
- Erosion of PE time in primary schools by pressure of needing academic success for league tables
- Erosion of play/break times and dinner time by same pressure

attributes.action: Ensure school curriculum includes educating students on crime and consequences
attributes.background: Crime at young ages affects everyone in the community. It affects the offender as they should be learning and that is postponed or permanently stopped. It would affect the victim as it would affect any victim mentally. It will also affect the community as a whole, making the area look atrocious.

attributes.action: Abandon government plans to include calories on all restaurant menus
attributes.background: The government’s plan to list calories on all restaurant menus not only will remove the joy of eating out at restaurants, but also is a cruel hinderance to those recovering from eating disorders. We need a more nuanced way to define what is “healthy” than obsessively listing and tracking calories.
attributes.additional_details: https://www.telegraph.co.uk/politics/2018/09/04/plans-force-restaurants-cafes-takeaways-display-calorie-counts/

attributes.action: all children to attend the school nearest to their home address
attributes.background: Remove parental choice of school - You only have to travel in commuter time in school holidays vs other dates to know how much congestion and pollution,and  along with wasted man hours and traffic collisions are caused by children having to commute to their parents' chosen schools.
attributes.additional_details:
What a waste of time and valuable growing up, as well as the safety risks.

Parents would be better off spending their time energy and money on helping to improve their local school rather than selfishly encouraging their children to attend 'better' ones further away.

attributes.action: Make Senior and 16-25 Railcards follow the same Time & Fare restrictions
attributes.background: The 16-25 Railcard is the same cost and appears to be the same as the Senior Railcard (for over 60's). However, the 16-25 card has a list of restrictions that do not apply to the senior card, including a minimum fare and time restrictions. Why are there not the same allowances?
attributes.additional_details: Apprentices, students & the young in work for the most, have to be up early for Uni/Work etc. and are notoriously hard up, at the start of there careers/working bottom end jobs. However while commuting to work as an apprentice, seeing a senior citizen go from there new range rover to the train, then be receiving a vastly discounted fare for the same journey does not seem fair. There are 2 sides as there are less well off elderly, and youth with money, however why give to one and not the other?

attributes.action: Create a governing body to regulate private landlords to protect tenants
attributes.background: Too many private landlords do not carry out their legal obligations at the detriment of their tenants. A governing body is required to regulate such requirements and support tenants whom need to report such landlords for not meeting safety & obligatory maintenance and to investigate harrassment
attributes.additional_details: If you have been subjected to unsafe living conditions, patronising responses, lack of communication and no action taken on much needed property repairs and/or maintenance, then a regulating body is required to fully investigate in depth. Local authorities currently do not have enough capacity to assist with such needs across the UK.

attributes.action: Require phone providers to stop charging for handsets on expiration of contract
attributes.background: The government should make it law that mobile phone providers should be obliged to make sure that any customers staying in a contract past the end of a fixed deal have their monthly bill reduced to reflect the cost of the handset.
attributes.additional_details:
In October 2017 Citizens Advice found that three of the four largest mobile phone providers – Vodafone, EE and Three – continued to charge customers extra for a handset after it had been paid off as part of their fixed deal.  The majority of people who are caught out by this are the over 65s.

https://www.citizensadvice.org.uk/about-us/how-citizens-advice-works/media/press-releases/mobile-phone-networks-overcharging-loyal-customers-by-up-to-38-a-month/

attributes.action: Lower the NHS charges at dentists
attributes.background: The NHS charges at dentists are becoming more akin to private treatment and beyond the budget of ordinary people. The result is that people suffer poor dental health because they can't afford the cost.
attributes.additional_details: The average cost of seeing a Dental Hygienist is now £59. A 6 monthly check up is over £30 and if work needs doing, it can be hundreds of pounds.

attributes.action: Ban night shift working, for the sake of the health of workers
attributes.background: Studies have established that the health of workers in the UK is directly negatively affected by night shift working. I ask Parliament to hold a debate over this practice. Why are hard-working people being made to suffer unnecessarily, and why does the Health and Safety at Work Act not protect them?
attributes.additional_details: Long-term night shift work is associated with an increased risk of certain cancers, as well as metabolic problems, heart disease, ulcers and gastrointestinal problems. People who work night shifts or rotating shifts often don't sleep enough. Long-term sleep deprivation is known to be bad for health. Statistics show that a large amount of UK workers are shift workers and, in particular, night shift workers.

attributes.action: Dual the entire route of the A47
attributes.background: Tens of thousands of vehicles use the A47 every year. It is one of the most important roads in the UK more specifically the East of England. The route is also used by numerous logistics companies. However there are also hundreds of accidents every   causing confusion and delay.

attributes.action: Stop the Lifetime ISA & allow customers to withdraw their money with no penalty
attributes.background: Lifetime Isas allow adults under 40 to save for their first home or pension in one pot with a 25 per cent bonus from the Government. They were revealed in the 2016 budget and launched in April 2017. However, many are being caught out by the strict withdrawal rules.

attributes.action: Require companies to tell applicants the status of their job application.
attributes.background: Applicants should have a right to receive a reply from employers. This petition isn’t to push for critical feedback, but a simple “yes, you have a job” or “no, you haven’t." Failure to reply within a reasonable time-frame should be punished by fines, depending on the company's size.
attributes.additional_details:
A simple reply from an employer can help better a person's options. People seeking work explore and apply for various types of employment, unskilled jobs, career and training programs or apprenticeships; and often, many of these jobs would start around the same time. Some options may be better than others depending on the individual, and a simple reply of “yes”, “no” or “still being reviewed” can improve a person on making a better choice financially or for their lifestyle.

Placing an applicant in a state of suspense and stress, sometimes for months when it comes to programs and apprenticeships is a cruel situation to place anyone in, when a feedback about the application will allow an applicant to move on and accept other options.
